title: Andy Wu
text:
Econometrics of Markets and Competition (ECOM40007/90017), 2024 - Present

ECOM40007/90017 covers empirical industrial organization at the Honours undergraduate and Masters level. Topics include differentiated product demand estimation (Berry 1994; BLP), merger simulations, auctions, search, static entry models, and production function estimation.

Competition and Strategy (ECON20005), 2024 - Present

ECON20005 is a second-year elective that introduces students to game theory and its applications in everyday life, as well as the analysis of firms’ strategic behavior and competition.

Computational Economics (ECON90055), 2023 - 2025

ECON90055 introduces modern computational methods to solve and estimate structural models, analyze spatial and other datasets, and apply these tools to economic research.

title: Xiaosong (Andy) Wu
text:
Xiaosong (Andy) Wu
Senior Lecturer (Assistant Professor)
Department of Economics, University of Melbourne 
Research interests
Industrial Organization; Applied Microeconomics; Competition and Antitrust Policy; Quantitative Marketing
My research lies in empirical industrial organization and competition policy, with a focus on how information shapes consumer behavior, firm strategy, and market outcomes.
Contact
Email: andy.wu1@unimelb.edu.au
Department of Economics | Faculty of Business & Economics
Room 320, Level 3, 111 Barry Street, Carlton
University of Melbourne, Victoria 3010, Australia
